content.question: An oscillator is made from a block of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and a series-parallel combination of linear springs. The oscillator is attached to a ceiling as shown in the figure. The springs are of two types that have spring constants <math alttext="k sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="k sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="k sub 2 equals 2 k sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The block is displaced downward a distance y and released. Which of the following is a correct Newton’s second law equation for the motion of this oscillator?

choices.label: <math alttext="the second derivative of y with respect to t equals the negative of three fourths of the fraction k sub 1 over m, end fraction, times y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the second derivative of y with respect to t equals negative of the fraction 4 over 3 times the fraction m over k sub 1, end sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the second derivative of y with respect to t equals negative 4 times the fraction k sub 1 over m, end fraction, times y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the second derivative of y with respect to t equals negative 3 times the fraction k sub 1 over m, end fraction, times y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the second derivative of y with respect to t equals the negative of two fifths of the fraction k sub 1 over m, end fraction, times y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the second derivative of y with respect to t equals the negative of three fourths of the fraction k sub 1 over m, end fraction, times y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
